instruction: How were machine learning algorithms utilized in the framework to predict soil organic matter (SOM) content from FTIR-ATR spectra?
Output: In the framework, machine learning algorithms were utilized to predict soil organic matter (SOM) content from Fourier mid-infrared attenuation total reflectance spectroscopy (FTIR-ATR) spectra. Specifically, the Lasso, partial least squares (PLS), support vector regression (SVR), and convolutional neural networks (CNN) models were used for this purpose. These algorithms were trained using the FTIR-ATR spectra data and corresponding SOM content measurements from the 245 soil samples collected in northeast China. The trained models were then used to predict the SOM content for the entire study area based on the FTIR-ATR spectra obtained from Sentinel-2 images and DEM derivatives. The performance of these machine learning algorithms was evaluated in terms of their accuracy and resolution in predicting SOM content.
